channel.title: RNZ Covid-19 Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Covid-19 headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for 12 October - all the day's events
item.description: The woman who travelled into Northland with another who tested positive for Covid-19 has symptoms of the virus, Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield says.

item.title: Principals confident most staff will comply with mandatory vaccine order
item.description: School principals are confident their staff will comply with the government's order to get fully vaccinated before 1 January.

item.title: Couple incredulous they haven't been contacted over Northland case
item.description: A Northland couple who celebrated their wedding anniversary at the same Northland hotel a Covid-19 case visited are shocked they still haven't been formally told.

item.title: Game puts players in charge of Covid-19 response
item.description: Have you ever watched the 1pm press conference and thought you'd do it all differently? Well now is your chance to see what would happen if you were in power.

item.title: Covid-19 summary: Mandatory vaccinations, 35 cases and no changes to alert levels
item.description: Mandatory vaccinations have been introduced for health and education workers as 35 new community cases are reported and the government confirms there will be no immediate changes to alert levels.

item.title: Alert levels remain unchanged, NZ at one of 'most challenging moments' in pandemic
item.description: Auckland will remain in alert level 3, step 1, for at least one more week while Waikato and Northland will stay in level 3 until 11.59pm on Thursday.

item.title: Covid-19: Person tests positive at Middlemore Hospital, 40 patients considered contacts
item.description: The person arrived at the emergency department on Friday for a non-Covid-19 related issue and tested positive today.

item.title: Mandatory vaccinations announced for health, education sector workers
item.description: School staff who work with children and students must be fully vaccinated by 1 January 2022.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates for 11 October
item.description: Schools in Auckland will remain closed after the school holidays finish at the end of this week.

item.title: Covid-19 data visualisations: NZ in numbers
item.description: Track how Auckland's move to level 3 is impacting the Covid outbreak with the latest case numbers, testing and vaccination data in New Zealand.

item.title: Covid-19: NSW restrictions eased, Victoria records 1612 cases
item.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says cases are expected to rise as the state reopens but its health system is ready to handle them.

item.title: Why US workers are refusing vaccine ultimatums
item.description: Many US workplaces have issued ultimatums to staff to get vaccinated or lose their jobs, but some workers are sticking by their political, religious or health concerns and saying no.

item.title: Teen tests positive to Covid-19 after Virgin Australia flight
item.description: A boy has tested positive for Covid-19 after being on the same flight as a Virgin Australia flight attendant who tested positive for the virus.

item.title: Appeal to young Māori to help protect whānau and get vaccinated
item.description: Iwi leaders are asking whānau to respect travel restrictions and to get vaccinated to help slow the spread of the Delta outbreak.

item.title: Pāmu ponders restrictions for unvaccinated staff
item.description: The state owned farmer Pāmu has said it may need to look at putting in place some restrictions for unvaccinated staff in the future.

item.title: Why we must not allow Covid-19 to become endemic in NZ
item.description: Opinion - As New Zealand switches to suppression, those who argue that Covid-19 will become part of our lives either do not understand or ignore what this would mean.

item.title: Call to axe steps system and fix gaps in vaccine mandates
item.description: Epidemiologist Professor Michael Baker believes Auckland will be at level 2 by Christmas - but in the meantime the steps system should be scrapped.

item.title: South Islanders' frustrations growing as it remains Covid-free
item.description: As daily Covid-19 cases continue to climb in Auckland, there are rumblings of rebellion in the South Island and a call to break away from the team of five million.

item.title: PM wants officials to consider naming contact of positive case
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says a Covid-19 case's refusal to cooperate with health officials is "beyond irresponsible...dangerous".

item.title: Appeal to PHOs to share details of any anti-vax doctors
item.description: Advocacy group General Practice New Zealand has written to Primary Health Organisations this afternoon, calling for more anti-vax doctors to be reported.

item.title: Covid-19: 35 new community cases in NZ today as alert level decision looms
item.description: The Ministry of Health says two staff members at North Shore Hospital have returned positive results for Covid-19 following a positive case reported yesterday.

item.title: Covid-19: PM Jacinda Ardern says Katikati case, family return negative result
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says despite the negative result in the Bay of Plenty, case vaccination rates need to remain high, with the Delta outbreak being "not just an issue for Auckland".

item.title: South Islanders consider Covid risk as virus spreads beyond Auckland
item.description: It is probably just a matter of time before Covid-19 spreads to the South Island, which hasn't had widespread transmission for 18 months, experts say.

item.title: Covid-19: Aucklanders call for clarity ahead of alert level decision
item.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff says "there is a hell of a lot of hurt in the community, not simply the disease but the effect on human beings who have had their incomes slashed, whose businesses are failing, kids that can't be educated".

item.title: Physios question why retail can open in step 2, but they still can't work
item.description: Patients are unnecessarily suffering because some health professionals are unable to deliver face-to-face care under level 3 restrictions, Allied Health practitioners say.

item.title: New Zealand signs deal to purchase new Covid-19 treatment
item.description: Pharmac said the antiviral drug molnupiravir would be used to treat mild to moderate Covid-19 symptoms.

item.title: Covid-19 case numbers could soon surpass 100 a day - expert
item.description: Auckland's daily Covid-19 case numbers could reach triple figures by the end of the month, data modelling expert Shaun Hendy says.

item.title: Thousands get vaccinated in Northland after region moves to level 3
item.description: The Northland region has seen a promising sign that vaccination rates will increase after a high turnout over the weekend.

item.title: Infection rate on the rise since move to level 3 - Covid-19 modeller
item.description: University of Canterbury Covid-19 modeller professor Michael Plank says with infection rates on the rise, it's no time to loosen restrictions.

item.title: Covid-19 wrap: 60 new cases, scramble in regions over positive case visits
item.description: The Ministry of Health announced 60 new community cases of Covid-19 today, the most in nearly six weeks, while Northland and the Bay of Plenty continued to deal with positive cases visiting their regions.

item.title: Covid-19: Northland case's companion contacted, but not found
item.description: Authorities have now contacted a woman who travelled in Northland with a woman who later tested positive for Covid-19, but they still don't know her location.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 60 new community cases reported in NZ today
item.description: The Ministry of Health has announced 60 new community cases of Covid-19 today - 56 in Auckland, three in Waikato and the one in Bay of Plenty announced last night.

item.title: Katikati on high alert after person tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: The Bay of Plenty town of Katikati is on high alert after a person tested positive yesterday for Covid-19, with new locations of interest in the region named by the Ministry of Health this morning.

item.title: Covid-19 updates: Warning to brace for higher case numbers
item.description: There are 60 new community cases of Covid-19 today, as concern over the virus continues to spread in Northland and Bay of Plenty. See how the day unfolded with RNZ's live blog coverage.

item.title: Vaccine certificates need legal backing - hospitality sector
item.description: The hospitality industry wants to see vaccine certificates introduced but is furious about the legal risks they pose.

item.title: Lockdown extensions causing 'economic carnage' - businesses
item.description: Extended lockdowns are crushing news for retailers and businesses as many battle for survival, and more government support is needed, industry figures say.

item.title: Northland lockdown: Police seek second woman who travelled with Covid-19 case
item.description: Police have not yet found the woman who travelled through Northland with a Covid-infected case, with new locations of interest in the region, which is now in alert level 3.

item.title: Covid-19: Positive case reported in the Bay of Plenty
item.description: The Ministry of Health says a test taken yesterday in Auckland has returned positive today for a person currently in Katikati.

item.title: Restaurant owner gets behind vaccinations with free fish and chips
item.description: The offer of free fish and chips for everyone receiving a dose of the Pfizer vaccine has gone down well in Christchurch today.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 34 new cases in the community today
item.description: There have been 34 new community cases reported in New Zealand today, with no cases yet reported in Northland after the region moved into alert level 3 overnight.

item.title: PM visits Ruatorea to help beef up vaccinations
item.description: The Prime Minister visited Ruatōrea in the remote Tairāwhiti Gisborne today to encourage a boost in vaccinations.

item.title: Sydney set to ease key Covid-19 curbs
item.description: Sydney businesses are preparing to welcome fully vaccinated residents from tomorrow, as restrictions in New South Wales ease after 100 days in lockdown.

item.title: Singapore expands quarantine-free travel, eyes 'new normal'
item.description: Singapore is opening its borders to quarantine-free travel from more countries and preparing for a "new normal" to live with Covid-19, but unvaccinated residents face restrictions.

item.title: Victoria: 1890 new Covid-19 cases, five deaths
item.description: Australia's state of Victoria has recorded 1890 new locally acquired cases of Covid-19, and five people have died with the virus.

item.title: 'On tenterhooks': Region on edge over possible infections, mayor says
item.description: An "uncooperative" woman who travelled from Auckland to Northland and is now Covid-positive should have considered the risk she posed, the Whangārei mayor says.

item.title: Iwi-led border controls back in Northland as region enters alert level 3
item.description: Iwi-led border control checkpoints are being deployed today in Northland after the district was moved to alert level 3 at midnight.

item.title: Delta in Taranaki would be 'perfect storm' for Māori - health officials
item.description: Earlier this week, only 24 percent of Taranaki Māori were fully vaccinated while just under 40 percent of the general population had both jabs - two of the lowest rates in the country.

item.title: Easing Auckland's restrictions 'a very risky strategy'- public health expert
item.description: A public health expert is frustrated the government relaxed alert level restrictions in Auckland, saying the country's vaccination rate did not warrant it.

item.title: Covid-19 summary: Northland to move to level 3, 44 new community cases reported
item.description: Community case numbers jumped to 44 today, while the government announced Northland would move to alert level 3 after a person who travelled throughout the region tested positive.

item.title: Northland to move to Alert Level 3 tonight as positive case proves uncooperative
item.description: Northland will move to Alert Level 3 restrictions from 11:59pm tonight, after the case who travelled into the region was uncooperative with contact tracing efforts. Watch the Covid-19 Response Minister's briefing here.

item.title: PM among vaccine cheerleaders in underperforming region
item.description: The government's beefing up efforts to vaccinate Māori against Covid-19 by getting the prime minister out on the road.

item.title: MIQ system to be challenged in High Court
item.description: The group Grounded Kiwis has filed papers in the High Court in Welligton today seeking an urgent judicial review of the isolation and quarantine system.

item.title: Victoria records highest daily tally of 1965 new Covid-19 cases, five deaths
item.description: Victoria has recorded 1965 new locally acquired cases of Covid-19 and five deaths.

item.title: Covid-19 updates: Northlanders line up for vaccine as alert level rises
item.description: A Northland vaccination clinic has been getting through an average of one person a minute, as the region moves to alert level 3 tonight. See how the day's Covid-19 news unfolded with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 44 new cases in the community today
item.description: There have been 44 new cases of Covid-19 reported in the community today, including three in Waikato, the Ministry of Health has reported.

item.title: People unable to get Pfizer vaccine fearful of consequences
item.description: The Ministry of Health has hinted that it will look at alternative vaccines for people who react badly to the Pfizer shot.

item.title: Dozens of potential contacts after Middlemore Hospital patient tests positive
item.description: A non-Covid patient who has visited the hospital twice this week before testing positive has led to fears of two possible Covid-19 exposure events.

item.title: Aucklanders keen to make the most of double-bubble weekend socialising
item.description: With the green light for double-bubble outdoor gatherings, Aucklanders are getting ready to fire up their barbeques and pack picnic hampers for their first weekend meet-ups in a long time.

item.title: Medical Council has 'zero tolerance' for anti-vax messages from doctors as it receives 23 complaints
item.description: Chairperson Doctor Curtis Walker says there have been 23 complaints regarding doctors spreading anti-vaccination misinformation but that they are a "very small" number of the country's health professionals.

item.title: Health experts to work with Mongrel Mob on vaccine hesitancy
item.description: A health expert who will front a Waikato Mongrel Mob vaccination event next week says there is a duty of care to help inform all New Zealanders.
